newsitem.title: CHINA: China congress slams Europe parliament over Taiwan.
newsitem.headline: China congress slams Europe parliament over Taiwan.

text.p: China's National People's Congress lashed out at the European Parliament on Friday for welcoming the foreign minister of rival Taiwan, saying the move was premeditated provocation against the Chinese people.

The congress, widely considered a rubber stamp body under the ruling Communist Party, expressed its "utmost indignation" in a statement carried by the Xinhua news agency at the parliament's invitation to Taiwan Foreign Minister John Chang.
Chang addressed a committee of the Euroepean legislature on Thursday in a move certain to anger China, which considers Taiwan a rebel province and has long tried to isolate it diplomatically.

"This is a grave event constituting an infringement upon China's sovereignty, interference in China's internal affairs, and a premeditated provocation against the Chinese people," the the Foreign Affairs Committee of the congress said.
It said some members of the European parliament had tried in the past few years to obstruct Chinese unity by conspiring with the Taiwan authorities to create disturbances.

"Their deeds can only harm others in the beginning and harm themselves in the end," it said. "China-EU relations can only move forward in a sound and steady way on the basis of mutual respect and non-interference in each other's internal affairs."
